explanation: The report is correct for the provided configuration. With the given macro definitions LFS_UNLOCK(cfg) expands to ((void)cfg) which performs no observable action (it merely evaluates and discards lfs->cfg). The statement LFS_UNLOCK(lfs->cfg); is executed but has no effect on program behaviour in this build, so its removal would not change behaviour — this matches MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2’s definition of dead code. (Caveat: if the cfg expression or lfs object were declared volatile, or if the macro expands to a real unlock in other build configurations, the statement would have observable effects and would not be dead; but in the specific project build shown it is dead code.)
